title: Couscous
summary: Couscous[lower-alpha 1] is a North African dish[2] of small[lower-alpha 2] steamed granules of rolled durum wheat semolina[3] that is traditionally served with a stew spooned on top. Pearl millet, sorghum, Bulgur and other cereals can be cooked in a similar way in other regions and the resulting dishes are also sometimes called couscous.[4]: 18 [5]
